content.raw:
1. this line is wrong:
   wget #!/osrf/subt/raw/default/docker/subt/Dockerfile

should be (as of May 24):
   wget #!/osrf/subt/raw/default/docker/subt_shell/Dockerfile


2. Also, not sure if its my particular setup only (GTX 960, UBUNTU 18.04), but this line:
    docker run --runtime=nvidia --rm nvidia/cuda nvidia-smi

fails because the command wants CUDA 10, but I have CUDA 9 on my system. However, CUDA 10 would require an nvida driver  >- 410, which is ahead of the driver recommended on the subt install page (nvidia-384).  In summary, you can tell docker to use CUDA 9 by changing the above command to:

    docker run --runtime=nvidia --rm nvidia/cuda:9.0-base nvidia-smi

1. this line is wrong: wget #!/osrf/subt/raw/default/docker/subt/Dockerfile

should be (as of May 24): wget #!/osrf/subt/raw/default/docker/subt_shell/Dockerfile

  1. Also, not sure if its my particular setup only (GTX 960, UBUNTU 18.04), but this line: docker run --runtime=nvidia --rm nvidia/cuda nvidia-smi

fails because the command wants CUDA 10, but I have CUDA 9 on my system. However, CUDA 10 would require an nvida driver >- 410, which is ahead of the driver recommended on the subt install page (nvidia-384). In summary, you can tell docker to use CUDA 9 by changing the above command to:

docker run --runtime=nvidia --rm nvidia/cuda:9.0-base nvidia-smi
